Toasting pumpkin seeds brings out all of their untapped flavor, so be sure to take them to a deep golden brown color. You can use any variety you like, though the cook time may vary, so keep an eye on them as they toast. You can also sprinkle the seasoning on fruit with lime and hot sauce, vanilla ice cream, popcorn, even scrambled eggs, or try it in this seafood stew. Ingredients1½cups raw pumpkin seeds (pepitas)¾tsp. kosher saltPreparationStep 1Preheat oven to 350°. Toast pumpkin seeds on a large rimmed baking sheet, tossing halfway through, until golden brown, 20–25 minutes. Let cool.Step 2Transfer pumpkin seeds to a food processor, add salt, and pulse until very finely ground.Step 3Do ahead: Alguashte can be made 4 weeks ahead.
